1: <sup>1</sup> I will extol thee, O LORD; for thou hast lifted me up, and hast not made my foes to rejoice over me.
2: <sup>2</sup> O LORD my God, I cried unto thee, and thou hast healed me.
3: <sup>3</sup> O LORD, thou hast brought up my soul from the grave: thou hast kept me alive, that I should not go down to the pit.
4: <sup>4</sup> Sing unto the LORD, O ye saints of his, and give thanks at the remembrance of his holiness.
5: <sup>5</sup> For his anger endureth but a moment; in his favour is life: weeping may endure for a night, but joy cometh in the morning.
6: <sup>6</sup> And in my prosperity I said, I shall never be moved.
7: <sup>7</sup> LORD, by thy favour thou hast made my mountain to stand strong: thou didst hide thy face, and I was troubled.
8: <sup>8</sup> I cried to thee, O LORD; and unto the LORD I made supplication.
9: <sup>9</sup> What profit is there in my blood, when I go down to the pit? Shall the dust praise thee? shall it declare thy truth?
10: <sup>10</sup> Hear, O LORD, and have mercy upon me: LORD, be thou my helper.
11: <sup>11</sup> Thou hast turned for me my mourning into dancing: thou hast put off my sackcloth, and girded me with gladness;
12: <sup>12</sup> To the end that my glory may sing praise to thee, and not be silent. O LORD my God, I will give thanks unto thee for ever.
